LayoutNode.Content: Echo Dot (2nd Generation) -Smart speaker with Alexa -White
LayoutNode.SRC: Echo Dot (2nd Generation) - Smart speaker with Alexa - White

LayoutNode.Content: Would 3 2nd gen echo dots in one 1000 square foot home sync with eachother or would there be issues? Example, 1 order of pizza might turn into 3. asked on September 14, 2016 Answer this question Answer See all questions about this product
LayoutNode.SRC:
Would 3 2nd gen echo dots in one 1000 square foot home sync with eachother or would there be issues? Example, 1 order of pizza might turn into 3.Would 3 2nd gen echo dots in one 1000 square foot home sync with eachother or would there be issues? Example, 1 order of pizza might turn into 3.
asked on September 14, 2016
Answer See all questions about this product
Showing 1-10 of 252 answers

LayoutNode.Content: I have 5 Amazon Dots (second gen) in my living room, den, master bedroom, guest room and my small office. I have two story 2700 sq ft hous. They never conflect with each other. Ocassionally, and this is rare, two will answer a question if two hear it, but again pretty rare. You can definately be playing music from Prime, Pandora or IHeart radio on one dot, and the others will work indendentely playing different music or answering questions, what ever you choose. Each of my 5 dots can and do control my two Ecobee3 thermostats and my 12 Wemo enabled devices (lights, etc) All of my DOTS have no trouble pairing and unpairing from myt bluetooth enabled stereo systems. Overall, I am very happy with Dot and Alexa. The biggest drawback to Dot/Echo and Alexa in general is that it uses Microsoft BING as its search engine instead of GOOGLE which I find far superior for getting answers to questions. With the release of Google's Home device, I seriously doubt Echo/Dot/Alexa will have access to the Google search engine. I am happy with my chorice of the Alexa-Dot system. LouCutrone Â· November 30, 2016 Comments | Leave a Comment | 20 of 23 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No

LayoutNode.Content: The dot and echo do not sync with each other, they operate independently which is a disappointment if you expect to use one or the other to be able to play music or features in different parts of the house, that will not happen. Furthermore, supposedly you can sync one with the other via bluetooth, but try doing that when they are separated by several rooms. I think Amazon really missed the boat on this one when they have failed to allow echo or a chosen dot to act as a master for all the others. It does work very well through a power amp to play thru speakers connected to the amp as you would say bose acousimass speakers. And the dot works just as the echo does. But the inability to be able to have dots and echo play in tandem thought the house is a major failure - as far as we're concerned. reader Â· October 24, 2016 Comments | Leave a Comment | 31 of 41 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No

LayoutNode.Content: Another solution to avoid multiple devices responding is to use a different wake-up name for each. Currently we are limited to 3 choices: Alexa, Echo and Amazon. I have one Alexa and two first gen Dots. Each of the Dots are using "Echo" as their wake-up word and at opposite ends of the house, no prob. Meryl08 Â· September 14, 2016 Comments | Leave a Comment | 42 of 57 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No

LayoutNode.Content: A recent update made it so only one Alexa responds, even if they have the same wake name and both hear you. The Dot or Echo closest to your voice will respond. Daniel S. Sparks Â· November 21, 2016 Comments | Leave a Comment | 12 of 14 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No
LayoutNode.SRC: A recent update made it so only one Alexa responds, even if they have the same wake name and both hear you. The Dot or Echo closest to your voice will respond.Daniel S. Sparks Â· November 21, 2016 Comments| Leave a Comment | 12 of 14 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No
| Report abuse

LayoutNode.Content: The new ESP (Echo Spatial Perception) feature will help you with that. Only the echo device closest to you will respond. ESP is being released with the new Dot and will also be pushed to existing devices with a new update. Nick Z Â· September 14, 2016 Comments | Leave a Comment | 38 of 55 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No

LayoutNode.Content: Normally, that should not be a problem. It is set up so that only the nearest device responds or takes your orders etc. But look at this review, there are reasons that speak against it: http://amzn.to/2rf9zlr He has a problem and EVERY Echo response... Support Â· January 17, 2018 Comments | Leave a Comment | 2 of 2 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No

LayoutNode.Content: Only one Echo (of any variety) will actually respond to your request. The sophisticated microphone array system with Echo Spacial Perception (ESP) will allow the Echos to determine which one you are closest to and then just that one will do the command. You will only get 1 pizza. As for "sync" there is a sort of sync. Because they are all connected to your Amazon account, they tie into the same information. So if you are listening to an audio book from Audible on one Echo you can stop it, move to another room, and then ask another Echo to pick up where you left off. If you add an item to your shopping list from any Echo, it goes to the same list. The list of connections could go on. The bad news is that connection also means that unless you pay extra, only one Echo can use Prime Music streaming at a time. Jared Bodine Â· May 10, 2017 Comments | Leave a Comment | 2 of 2 found this helpful. Do you? Yes No
LayoutNode.SRC:
Only one Echo (of any variety) will actually respond to your request. The sophisticated microphone array system with Echo Spacial Perception (ESP) will allow the Echos to determine which one you are closest to and then just that one will do the command. You will only get 1 pizza.
As for "sync" there is a sort of sync. Because they are all connected to your Amazon account, they tie into the same information. So if you are listening to an audio book from Audible on one Echo you can stop it, move to another room, and then ask another Echo to pick up where you left off. If you add an item to your shopping list from any Echo, it goes to the same list. The list of connections could go on.
